byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran.

abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan visits Iranian Pres Hassan Rouhani, as leaders put aside anger stirred when Erdogan made comment in March accusing Iran of trying to dominate region; visit points to countries' continued desire to forge economic ties and Turkey's reluctance to join international effort to constrain Iran.
lead_paragraph: Iran’s president, Hassan Rouhani, welcomed his Turkish counterpart, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, on a visit that was put in jeopardy after Mr. Erdogan lashed out at Tehran last month.

headline.main: Turkey and Iran Put Tensions Aside, for a Day
headline.print_headline: Turkey and Iran Put Tensions Aside, for a Day

snippet: Iran’s president, Hassan Rouhani, welcomed his Turkish counterpart, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, on a visit that was put in jeopardy after Mr. Erdogan lashed out at Tehran last month.
